intro: Vittadinia chamissonis var. arbuscula, commonly known as the narrow-leaf vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and grass-like foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. It is often found in open habitats such as dunes and coastal heathlands.
